Nicht umsonst ist DbD mein Steam-Spiel, mit dem meisten Spielstunden, denn es fährt mit meinen Emotionen regelrecht Karussell. Von beflügelt über frustriert bis hin zu äußerst komisch hält es alles bereit und bleibt bis zum letzten Atemzug spannend. Ich bin wirklich froh, dass die Entwickler so eifrig daran arbeiten und selbst nach über vier Jahren noch reichlich für Abwechslung sorgen.
Dafür möchte ich mich herzlich bedanken! <3
Si alto juego manga de wachines inadaptados

[b]Important notes:[/b]  Often people who have no previous exposure to this game will buy it thinking it will be similar to a horror movie or expository horror game. This is an e-sports game with a meta. Do not immerse yourself because it is unforgiving to new players who have this misconception. If you do not treat this game like it is purely about what perks are the best/help your playstyle, you are most likely going to die often and not learn why that's the case.

Also if you're a Survivor, THIS IS A TEAM GAME. This is directly from the game's Steam store page:

"Key Features
• Survive Together… Or Not - Survivors can either cooperate with the others or be selfish. Your chance of survival will vary depending on whether you work together as a team or if you go at it alone. Will you be able to outwit the Killer and escape their Killing Ground?"

Help your team. You're in a 4v1, not a 1v1v1v1v1. Why the game developers thought to encourage selfish behavior is beyond me.

Many Survivors will defend greedy gameplay in the post game. Be better than those people. Be better than the camping Killer. If you do end up playing it, help make this game better with your sporstmanship. Sometimes you will do everything amazingly and not mess up, but still get killed due to someone elses mistake. Acting independantly from the rest of your team makes that margin for everyone's failure even larger.

[b]Art Style/Graphics - 6/10[/b]
The game doesn't look all that great, but does well enough for itself. It does well to set the theme of gritty, dark, horror. That being the case, detail will often be lost either due to immersion or a lot of quick movement.
Despite not being all that amazing, this is a pretty demanding game for PC (not sure about console). 
My specs at time of this review:
Processor: Intel i5-7600K 3.80 GHz
RAM: 16GB 
GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970

Booting the game up is a CRAWL. Every time. With all settings on low, loading into matches can still take several minutes. Like all my other issues with the game, this could be solely on my end.

[b]Story - 5/10[/b]
The lore for Killers and Survivors doesn't affect gameplay at all, so I understand if this feedback is moot.
A majority of the Killers have creative enough backstories where they aren't the same as the entity. Less than half of them are "evil, just cuz." The Legion is probably the worst conceptually. The backstories help make the Killers feel like actual characters, along with decent flavor tie-ins to their respective maps.

[b]Soundtrack - 6/10[/b]
Similar to it's gloomy graphics, the music is on point for setting the tone for horror. Although a couple of the songs on the OST are highly recognizable after a couple logins or matches, I found the rest forgettable. The rest could be easily confused for another track. It does a good job at getting your adrenaline pumping in chases though.

Some of thes survivor's screams are pretty awful (lookin at you Elodie). Aside from that, the voice over work is as solid as "various grunts and crying" can get.

[b]Gameplay - 4/10[/b]
The balancing between killers and survivors has been and continues to be a teeter totter from the early days. Development is constantly adjusting the balance, but this does not make it balanced.
I think now more than ever it is close to being as balanced as the game has ever been. That being said it is still Killer favored gameplay.
  
Matchmaking is a coin toss. Half of the time it's as it should be, you get matched up with or against players of a similar rank. The other half of the time you will get someone with a RADICALLY different rank. There is no way to tell in a pre-game lobby. If you are a new player with one perk slot, you won't learn anything about what you could have done better when the killer dunks you onto the hook three times within the first ten minutes. It often just takes whoever is queued at the time and mashes them together. Good luck.

You cannot see the pre and post game lobby chat when you're playing crossplatform with anyone. This means if I go into a game on PC and my other three teammates are on Xbox, PS4, or Nintendo Switch, they cannot see what I type and vice versa. Same goes for the killer. If I am a killer and the four survivors are cross platform, I cannot give them a GG at the end of the game. Why is this?

Fairly often, simple bugs will take a while to get fixed. One example being the 4th year anniversary event which had an item that boosts the amount of blood points everyone in a game earns (both the killer and all survivors, regardless of who used it). The item failed to give ANY blood points rather than a boosted about. Behavior failed to say anything on the matter or fix the issue for several WEEKS into the event. They did extend the event, but the game has been out for 4 years. This event was very significant and there was time to prep for it. It shouldnt have happened, been fixed almost immediately, and been acknowledged that it was being worked on on day one.

[b]Overall - 4/10[/b]
More often than not, solo queue results in a bad time. So unless you have friends to play with, I wouldn't reccommend this game. A lot of people play scared/immersed and won't come save you if you need it. If you don't get salty over that kind of stuff, disregard this. I would just rather play a game I have fun playing the entire time (or most of it), or have fun being challenged by.

Reporting does nothing and it's absurd that I can't even give my teammates a GG after the game if they're cross platform.

DBD can induce salt in many ways. There is rampant BM in this game, on both Killer and Survivor side. Because there are often bugs and unforgiving gameplay,  If you are going to play this game, promote healthy gameplay on both sides, try not to BM, and please help your team.

Honestly the game is fun when you can get a match that is actually fair and balanced. Queue times are insanely long and when you do get a game you're either paired with someone way above your rank or way below. I get you need to be challenged to grow but that game really loses it's charm after being stomped into the ground multiple games in a row by someone who has hundreds of more hours in the game and is way higher ranked than you. The devs have known about this issue and haven't done anything to fix it. 

If you play with friends as a SWF it's a little better but still very one sided one way or the other.

I have never in my entire life of video games have had a game where my teammates disappoint me as much as this.  Besides that this game is super addicting and a whole lotta fun.  This game really isn't for everyone and can be extremely frustrating at times, cause of that the community can be VERY toxic or very nice, I've had a balance of both personally.   So when going into this game you always have to expect failure because otherwise you will probably get upset.  All that aside this game is really enjoyable and I recommend it
